home.title: National bruh Gallery - Simple Site Example
home.content:
In addition to hosting software and files, as part of development projects, [GitHub|https://github.com] also provides the resources to host dedicated websites, to present and demonstrate ones work. This project has been developed to provide a, relatively, simple system for creating a standard set of these webpages, based on a small set of text files, formatted as [JSON|https://www.json.org] files. It was built to work along side a number of other GitHub projects, to provide a method of creating a set of consistent webpages, delivered using [GitHub Pages|https://pages.github.com].


The content of the presented webpages are controlled with two main JSON files, augmented by optional additional files, stored in a local build folder.

  • Various site wide details are defined within the [site.json|site.json.html] file.
  • The content for the individual web-pages are defined within the [pages.json|pages.json.html] file. With the main pages being listed as tabs, and any sub-pages, or even sub-sub-pages etc, listed within drop-down menus from the related main page tab.

The content added to these JSON files is automatically processed every time the files are edited and a new set of webpages will be created.

Getting Started

[Join GitHub|https://github.com/join] ↠ [Copy/Fork|https://help.github.com/en/github/getting-started-with-github/fork-a-repo] the repository ↠ setup your [GitHub Action|https://help.github.com/en/actions] ↠ Edit the JSON files ↠ and Enjoy!

For more information see the [Instructions|instructions.html] page, the [JSON|JSON.html] pages and browse the various examples provided.

New to GitHub

For those new to GitHub there is a lot of general documentation out there, such as [Github Guides|https://guides.github.com/] and [Getting Started with GitHub|https://help.github.com/en/github/getting-started-with-github], but one particular place to start might be the series of videos, [GitHub for Poets|https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLRqwX-V7Uu6ZF9C0YMKuns9sLDzK6zoiV].

example-subpage-01.title: More detail might be needed in some areas
example-subpage-01.content:
Sub pages can be set up to provide additional content without adding to the list of tabs at the top of the page. These are nested using a simple parent child relationship.

NB: The display name of a page, which appears in the menus and navigation options can be different to the actual name used for the page. For example the display name of this page is Nice display pagename, whereas the actual page name in the URL is example-subpage-01. This can be useful as it is good practice to avoid long page names that include spaces.

Display names can be set in the [pages.json|pages.json.html] file, using the variable "displayName".

mirador-example.title: Simple Site - The IIIF Mirador Extension
mirador-example.content:
This extension uses the [IIIF|https://iiif.io] image viewer [Mirador|https://projectmirador.org/] to produce a customised presentation of a bespoke selection of IIIF manifests[@@IIIF manifests are simply a structured list of web based images resources that can be viewed in a IIIF compliant viewer, for more details see https://iiif.io/api/presentation/2.1/#table-of-contents]. It is an example of a special page that can be added to the [pages.json|pages.json.html] file. To change the objects displayed in this viewer, modify the mirador.json file found in the build folder in your Github Repository. Further information on the function of the viewer can be found under [Extensions|mirador-viewer.html] in the Documentation section of this site.

The Example

[##]

example-subpage-02.title: Another example of a simple sub page
example-subpage-02.content:
This example is displaying a list of four entries, displayed four times, demonstrating all four available display formats. An optional table of contents providing links to each of the defined groups has also been included.

It is an example of a special page that can be added to the [pages.json|pages.json.html] file. To change the objects displayed in this list, modify the list-example.json file found in the build folder in your Github Repository. Further information on types and formats of the lists displayed can be found under [Extensions|lists.html] in the Documentation section of this site.

example-sub-subpage-01.title: Probably not needed - more nesting
example-sub-subpage-01.content: As the relationships work on a simple parent child structure more and more pages can be nested as required.
example-sub-subpage-01.content right:
This example also shows that if needed you can automatically have multiple page names point towards the same page. This can be important if you have an old page name that needed to be changed, but has been referenced in the past.

The same page, but with the name "results.html"

Alternative page names can be set in the [pages.json|pages.json.html] file, using the variable "aliases", and multiple alternative names can be entered as a comma separated list.
